question.title: ANR TextureView on Galaxy S2 (GPU driver issue?)

node.contents: I do think, without code, we cannot help you.

astNode.text: I do think, without code, we cannot help you.

node.contents: Thanks Marek, I have added the code to reproduce it.

astNode.text: Thanks Marek, I have added the code to reproduce it.

node.contents: I have multiple TextureView inside a ListView that plays an opengl video stream. The code works fine on Nexus 4 (4.2), Galaxy S3 (4.1), and HTC One (4.0.3). However, ANR happens when I try to scroll the listview on S2 (SPH-D710VMUB, Virgin Mobile, 4.0.4) when opengl threads are running (deadlock). The ANR trace is provided below (isHardwareAccelerated() = true on listview).

astNode.text: I have multiple TextureView inside a ListView that plays an opengl video stream. The code works fine on Nexus 4 (4.2), Galaxy S3 (4.1), and HTC One (4.0.3). However, ANR happens when I try to scroll the listview on S2 (SPH-D710VMUB, Virgin Mobile, 4.0.4) when opengl threads are running (deadlock). The ANR trace is provided below (isHardwareAccelerated() = true on listview).

node.contents: Also note that if GLSurfaceView is used to handle the same openGL code, it works fine, but the Z-order messes up with multiple SurfaceViews in the same window for ICS devices. The GLTextureView is converted via instructions Converting from GLSurfaceView to TextureView (via GLTextureView)

astNode.text: Also note that if GLSurfaceView is used to handle the same openGL code, it works fine, but the Z-order messes up with multiple SurfaceViews in the same window for ICS devices. The GLTextureView is converted via instructions Converting from GLSurfaceView to TextureView (via GLTextureView)

node.contents: EDIT 1: Tried another implementation of GLTextureView, was able to locate the exact line. "eglSwapBuffers(EGLDisplay display, EGLSurface surface);" will block on S2 for some reason.

astNode.text: EDIT 1: Tried another implementation of GLTextureView, was able to locate the exact line. "eglSwapBuffers(EGLDisplay display, EGLSurface surface);" will block on S2 for some reason.

node.contents: Someone noticed: http://vec.io/posts/a-workaround-to-fix-opengl-eglswapbuffers-freezing glFinish(); is needed. Any idea?

astNode.text: Someone noticed: http://vec.io/posts/a-workaround-to-fix-opengl-eglswapbuffers-freezing glFinish(); is needed. Any idea?

node.contents: EDIT 2: Adding glFinish() or eglWaitGL() does not help. :( Suspect that they return immediately regardless....

astNode.text: EDIT 2: Adding glFinish() or eglWaitGL() does not help. :( Suspect that they return immediately regardless....

node.contents: EDIT 4: In case anyone is wondering, this is my implementation of the GLTextureView (https://github.com/edisonw/jjmpeg/tree/jjmpeg-1.0-dev/jjmpeg-android/src/com/edisonwang/android/player) It also includes FFMpeg playback stuff.

astNode.text: EDIT 4: In case anyone is wondering, this is my implementation of the GLTextureView (https://github.com/edisonw/jjmpeg/tree/jjmpeg-1.0-dev/jjmpeg-android/src/com/edisonwang/android/player) It also includes FFMpeg playback stuff.

node.contents: EDIT 5: It turns out to be a possible Qualcomm Adreno 200 series bug: https://developer.qualcomm.com/forum/qdevnet-forums/mobile-gaming-graphics-optimization-adreno/11525

astNode.text: EDIT 5: It turns out to be a possible Qualcomm Adreno 200 series bug: https://developer.qualcomm.com/forum/qdevnet-forums/mobile-gaming-graphics-optimization-adreno/11525

node.contents: Any ideas for how to debug this or why it happens?

astNode.text: Any ideas for how to debug this or why it happens?
